result.execSummary:
The defendant Micah J Stier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Do not associate with any known drug users. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber is granted for school and/or work. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Micah J Stier in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends w/held sent - 12 mos probation - no alc/cs-UA's, AODA/ft, any counseling necessary by agent; 45 days RCJ. Defense asks that the deft be allowed to motion the Court for expungement. The State objects to expungement.

BTC: sent w/held - 2 yrs probation. The defendant may motion the Court for expungement and will look favorably on same if deft successfully completes probation and has no other interface with the criminal justice system. No traffic violations/parking violations.

Conditions:
40 days RCJ/CFTS - Huber is granted for schooling and/or work or both. No alc/cs except by Rx. Absolute sobriety is required.

Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Micah J Stier in court with attorney Carolyn Delery.  Defendant Micah J Stier in custody.  Rebecca Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
